thread.title: WATCH: Trump Pulls Mega-Fan Onto Stage at Florida Rally
thread.title_full: WATCH: Trump Pulls Mega-Fan Onto Stage at Florida Rally

author: Wilmot Proviso
title: WATCH: Trump Pulls Mega-Fan Onto Stage at Florida Rally
text:
Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
When President Donald Trump resurrected his campaign-style rallies at Orlando Melbourne Airport on Saturday, his number one fan was in attendance. And, he got to see a lot more of the president than he — or the Secret Service — expected. 
According to CNN , Gene Huber — a man who had camped out since 4 a.m. to make sure that he was first on line to get into the event, was called up on stage by the president and handed the microphone to make a few remarks to the crowd. 
The president had seen footage of Huber waiting to get into the rally on television, which is when he decided to call Huber up. Advertisement - story continues below 
“I saw this man on television just now — you!” the president said, pointing to Huber. “That’s my guy, right there. Come here!” 
That’s when he beckoned him up onto the stage, much to the delight of the crowd and the consternation of the guys with the sunglasses and black Chevy Suburbans. Advertisement – story continues below 
“Don’t worry about him!” the president can be seen telling security. That’s when he gave the microphone over to Huber. 
“ Mr. President , thank you so, sir. We the people, our movement is the reason why our president of the United States is standing here in front of us today,” Huber the crowd. “When President Trump during the election promised all these things that he was going to do for us, I knew he was going to do this for us.” 
In an interview with “Fox News,” Huber said he was amazed. Advertisement - story continues below Trending Stories
